description:
Expected format of the top-level JSON config file. Note this interface is
used to generate the JSON schema for validation.

___name.description:
Name of the browser:

Options:
   - chrome
   - firefox
   - safari
   - edge
   - ie

___remoteUrl.description: A remote WebDriver server HTTP address to launch the browser from.

___removeArguments.description:
Command-line arguments that WebDriver normally adds by default when
launching the browser, which you would like to omit.

___headless.description: Whether to launch the headless (no GUI) version of this browser.

___addArguments.description: Additional command-line arguments to pass when launching the browser.

___cpuThrottlingRate.description:
Optional CPU Throttling rate. (1 is no throttle, 2 is 2x slowdown,
etc). This is currently only supported in headless mode.

___binary.description:
Path to the binary to use when launching this browser, instead of the
default one.

___height.description: Height of the browser window in pixels.

___width.description: Width of the browser window in pixels.

___windowSize.description: The size of new windows created from this browser. Defaults to 1024x768.

___name.description:

   - ie

___remoteUrl.description: A remote WebDriver server HTTP address to launch the browser from.

___addArguments.description: Additional command-line arguments to pass when launching the browser.

___binary.description:
Path to the binary to use when launching this browser, instead of the
default one.

___preferences.description:
Advanced preferences that are usually set from the about:config page
in Firefox (see
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/about-config-editor-firefox).

___width.description: Width of the browser window in pixels.

___windowSize.description: The size of new windows created from this browser. Defaults to 1024x768.

_88ConfigFileBenchmark.description: Expected format of a benchmark in a JSON config file.

___name.description: An optional label for this benchmark. Defaults to the URL.

___measurement.description:
Which time interval to measure.

Options:
   - callback: bench.start() to bench.stop() (default for fully qualified
     URLs.
   - fcp: first contentful paint (default for local paths)
   - global: result returned from window.tachometerResult (or custom
       expression set via measurementExpression)

___expand.description:
Recursively expand this benchmark configuration with any number of
variations. Useful for testing the same base configuration with e.g.
multiple browers or package versions.

$eref.description: Expected format of a benchmark in a JSON config file.

___name.description: An optional label for this benchmark. Defaults to the URL.

___measurement.description:
Which time interval to measure.

Options:
   - callback: bench.start() to bench.stop() (default for fully qualified
     URLs.
   - fcp: first contentful paint (default for local paths)
   - global: result returned from window.tachometerResult (or custom
       expression set via measurementExpression)

___expand.description:
Recursively expand this benchmark configuration with any number of
variations. Useful for testing the same base configuration with e.g.
multiple browers or package versions.

___url.description:
A fully qualified URL, or a local path to an HTML file or directory. If a
directory, must contain an index.html. Query parameters are permitted on
local paths (e.g. 'my/benchmark.html?foo=bar').

___packageVersions.description:
Optional NPM dependency overrides to apply and install. Only supported with
local paths.

___measurementExpression.description:
Expression to use to retrieve global result.  Defaults to
`window.tachometerResult`.

___browser.description:
Which browser to run the benchmark in.

Options:
   - chrome (default)
   - chrome-headless
   - firefox
   - firefox-headless
   - safari
   - edge
   - ie

___url.description:
A fully qualified URL, or a local path to an HTML file or directory. If a
directory, must contain an index.html. Query parameters are permitted on
local paths (e.g. 'my/benchmark.html?foo=bar').

___dependencies.description:
Map from NPM package to version. Any version syntax supported by NPM is
supported here.

___label.description: Required label to identify this version map.

___packageVersions.description:
Optional NPM dependency overrides to apply and install. Only supported with
local paths.

___measurementExpression.description:
Expression to use to retrieve global result.  Defaults to
`window.tachometerResult`.

___browser.description:
Which browser to run the benchmark in.

Options:
   - chrome (default)
   - chrome-headless
   - firefox
   - firefox-headless
   - safari
   - edge
   - ie

___name.description:
Name of the browser:

Options:
   - chrome
   - firefox
   - safari
   - edge
   - ie

___remoteUrl.description: A remote WebDriver server HTTP address to launch the browser from.

___removeArguments.description:
Command-line arguments that WebDriver normally adds by default when
launching the browser, which you would like to omit.

___headless.description: Whether to launch the headless (no GUI) version of this browser.

___addArguments.description: Additional command-line arguments to pass when launching the browser.

___cpuThrottlingRate.description:
Optional CPU Throttling rate. (1 is no throttle, 2 is 2x slowdown,
etc). This is currently only supported in headless mode.

___binary.description:
Path to the binary to use when launching this browser, instead of the
default one.

___windowSize.description: The size of new windows created from this browser. Defaults to 1024x768.

$eref.description:
A mapping from NPM package name to version specifier, as used in a
package.json's "dependencies" and "devDependencies".

___dependencies.description:
Map from NPM package to version. Any version syntax supported by NPM is
supported here.

___label.description: Required label to identify this version map.

___height.description: Height of the browser window in pixels.

___width.description: Width of the browser window in pixels.

_88PackageDependencyMap.description:
A mapping from NPM package name to version specifier, as used in a
package.json's "dependencies" and "devDependencies".

___$schema.description:
An optional reference to the JSON Schema for this file.

If none is given, and the file is a valid tachometer config file,
tachometer will write back to the config file to give this a value.

___resolveBareModules.description:
Whether to automatically convert ES module imports with bare module
specifiers to paths.

$eref.description: Expected format of a benchmark in a JSON config file.

___name.description: An optional label for this benchmark. Defaults to the URL.

___measurement.description:
Which time interval to measure.

Options:
   - callback: bench.start() to bench.stop() (default for fully qualified
     URLs.
   - fcp: first contentful paint (default for local paths)
   - global: result returned from window.tachometerResult (or custom
       expression set via measurementExpression)

___expand.description:
Recursively expand this benchmark configuration with any number of
variations. Useful for testing the same base configuration with e.g.
multiple browers or package versions.

___url.description:
A fully qualified URL, or a local path to an HTML file or directory. If a
directory, must contain an index.html. Query parameters are permitted on
local paths (e.g. 'my/benchmark.html?foo=bar').

___packageVersions.description:
Optional NPM dependency overrides to apply and install. Only supported with
local paths.

___measurementExpression.description:
Expression to use to retrieve global result.  Defaults to
`window.tachometerResult`.

___browser.description:
Which browser to run the benchmark in.

Options:
   - chrome (default)
   - chrome-headless
   - firefox
   - firefox-headless
   - safari
   - edge
   - ie

___timeout.description: The maximum number of minutes to spend auto-sampling (default 3).

___sampleSize.description: Minimum number of times to run each benchmark (default 50).

___horizons.description:
The degrees of difference to try and resolve when auto-sampling
(e.g. 0ms, +1ms, -1ms, 0%, +1%, -1%, default 0%).

___root.description: Root directory to serve benchmarks from (default current directory).
